column5: Are you crazy? With your wife's driving record(accident prone) you are considering buying new?LOL I would not put another cent in that vehicle and buy a used Japanese car. $5,000 Max

My younger son is still driving my 2001 (purchased 4/00)Saturn Coupe SC2 and loves it. It's loaded with even leather interior and still gets 38 mpg on the highway. It recently turned 100K and still looks new. I "HOPE" to someday get it back from him and drive it as my daily vehicle....but he said when he's done with it I'll need a tow truck to get it.

Just a thought but the emissions warrenty is usually mandated by the goverment. (here in the states anyway, may be the same in god's country) Often up to 80000 mi. If it wont pass emissions call saturn.

Wouldn't have been easier to take it for a drive, park next to a good fishing hole..place a brick on the gas peddle....let it scream wide open, while you went and caught a couple fish...when you come back... problem solved.  Sure would solve all the engine problems and make it not worth repairing.

I don't understand guyz????? I have the perfect wife, i'm aloud to do what ever i want..................................................................As long as she sayz it's O.K!!!!! By a cheap Honda or Vw, they look good and last forever, ask my wife shes been beaten her golf for years and believe me she drives it like she stole it!

All is cool.p/u the car tommorrow mornin and ill send it off for emmissionn.I hope it passes.And yes I am staying cool about it.I dislike arguments esp with the wiffey.I ussually loose anyway,LOL.Like a bud said last night.LOL If shes happy,your happy!We both smilled and kept quite!LOL
One day, somebody's gotta make a stand. One day, someone's gotta say enough.
Move north...no emissions testing here
Yep.. that's the farce of the whole thing. All the old used trade ins just get shipped to North Bay or above.... and I'm not talking about the wimmins!
Thought of that as well!wifes cool so am I!LOL
the wimmins come to our neck of the woods
She thinks she is punishing me. I don't mind the couch, kind of reminds me of camping anyway.
man...be one
Just think of the make up sex this will bring you.  There's a light at the end of the tunnel.

I had a 98 Saturn.  Biggest piece of crap I ever owned!  The rough idling could be the engine coolant temperature sensor.  Relatively inexpensive fix, located on the side of the block. Mine went and I had to actually push the gas pedal to start it.  Short time later, tranny went. Apparently a common breakdown on these cars. Tried 3 different trannies from the wrecker before the tranny shop told me to come and get the car and don't come back.  They were getting sick and tired of pulling the motor out and putting it back in.  Drove the piece of crap home in D1 at 25 km and called Teen Challenge Farm and donated it to them.  They came and picked it up and gave me a charitable donation receipt for $900 to use on my income tax.  Best thing to come of that heap!  PB
Scrap it and get a better used car! Sounds like its going to cost more than a used car to fix it...

THE CONCLUSION Well it was sent in for repairs and emissions.Monday it was done and passed the E test.Well, we went to get the sticker.The VIN on the test didnt match.  We went back and showed them.After talking they took the vin from the door, not the dash.Then I remembered years ago it was side swiped and the door was replaced. Anyway the retest failed and failed again.We had quit a bit of work done at NO CHARGE  Finally it passed,took 5 tries and a few repairs.They even fixed the ABS, and a sticky calipar at no charge.The only thing we paid for was a used egr valve for 50 bucks. The things we forget about, OH and she is happy as well.  THE END!

Women want to believe that they are smarter then you. Often they are! In either case it is better to allow them to hold on to this fact/delusion. Lets face it, most wives do far more than we ever will. Eat crow, she will love you all the more for it.

Here is how it works here.She turns the key and the it starts,If it doesn't then I have to make sure it does or a different unit that starts had better be there the next day.Glad she doesn't mind commuting on the tractor once in a while.A little give and take is a good thing.Tough to bush hog with a Scion,rough commute in the rain on a New Holland.Just so ya knows. Joe
It's a whole lot easier to push thru traffic on the New Holland though....  Art

Im sure some of you can relate to some degree.I have a saturn that needs to go.It serves no purpose and things are going wrong.Well the boss says to fix the exhaust and she demanded that it be put back on the rd immediately.Me,I say no, and find another one.Well everything went to the roof,oh man!!!!!!.I can give a list on this vehicle,oh man,I surely can. Well its off to the exhaust shop,and emmisions afterwards.Note to self(tell wife I TOLD YOU SO).Anyway it wont pass.Irratic idle prob,possibly in a tranny solenoid.Oh and the egr is leaking threw the diaphram,HMMMMMM, NO PAS! This wiffey of mine is talking to a mechanic!!!!DA,But she knows better!  We will see what happens soon enough!PLease stay tuned,TO BE CONTINUED!LOL
be nice and take the wife out tonight      .    .   .    .    .   .   .   .one bullet should do the job, if you are a good shot
LOL BTW, The couch is more comfy.I get more sleep!SAY whats on your mind guys cus im Pissed off right now,and I may go fishing.LOL

I'm on the flipside. I want to keep our van but my wife wants a new car. It's been by far the most reliable vehicle we've had and it runs perfect. The downside is that she's been driving it since new ('97) and I think she's just tired of it. I might have to replace it because every time I want something (new Terrova) I hear about the van. The funny part of it is; when we have bad weather I'll offer the 4WD Suburban and she declines. She says she's more comfortable driving the 2WD Astro in the snow!!!  Getting back to your question... when is enough, enough? I guage immediate and upcoming repairs vs. monthly payments. When the van need a new transmission ($1600) I pondered whether or not we'd get another 4 months worry free out of it vs. paying $400/mo on a new vehicle. You can say the car isn't worth putting the money into but it's usually cheaper than replacing it. In other words, if I knew the van needed a new engine now and a set of tires in a couple of months, it'd be gone. Our maintenance costs have yet to exceed $2000/yr. It helps when you can do a lot of repairs yourself.

My wife and I have an  understanding......I don't tell her how to cook and she doesn't tell me when I can or can't buy a new vehicle.  I buy a brand new truck every 3 - 5 years and she makes the best roast beef dinner you'll find anywhere.  It's a system that's kept us VERY happily married for nearly 44 years.

....and less than 20 yrs from now you'll be sittin' on the deck somewhere havin' a beer. Option #2: Fix the damned car, it'll be cheaper than a Divorce. Always remember, you Married her for some damned reason.

There's been quite a few problems with Saturns, if it is as bad as you say, it would not be worth it to invest more money into it. Though it sounds like financially you have no choice so I say fix it, and when the car breaks down, you have the I told you so card to play.lol
....or you could always say: "Dang honey, that was a surprise!" What do you think we should do now?" Hahaha  It always makes someone feel better, when they are included in the process.
My "Whine about the wife on an open forum" filter doesn't seem to be working.  Any of you MODS have a patch for me to fix that

you ever watch the marriage ref? give them a try, it wont solve anything but at least we get a good laugh about it,  i say scrap it and buy a new TRUCK and dont tell her about it until it's sittin in the driveway, might as well buy a boat too,     AHAHAHAH can u tell im not married, sorry bud

OK,a little history on the vehicle.My dad cringed at first buying it new.He liked the v8 chevys as I do.Well he he was injured at work and needed something economical.And it was to this day.He liked the fact that the door panels bounced,LOL.And truely enough I had to put it to the test with a shopping cart in the summer of 95.LOL.Thats me at the time.LOL.Anyway it was good,clean and quick.Well Dada past away and mom drove it.It was time for a new car.Bonus,free car for the wife,ah no!2400 bucks in show room condition.No prob!4weeks later it looked like a tornado went threw it. Anyway, shortly after a CURB HIT HER!.NEW SUBFRAME,I put in.NOT HAppy at all.Then 2 rims a month later.(I didnt ask)I KNEW!!!!!!!!!!AGHHHHHHH!!!!!!!Some little problems due to idiots trying to steel it. ANYWHOOOOO, for the last little incident,arghhhhh!!!!!Shesays she backed up and went forward in the the drive way and heard a noise.HMMMMMMM!!!! Wiffey noise.I came home and found the exhaust system wrapped around the rear axle and clinching it.AND IM THE BAD GUY HERE????????????????

To continue on,Its at the shop and the exhaust workis done,250 bucks plus 50 tow bill.NOW the emissions,HEHEHE, and im not laughing at all.The egr vavle is gone(300plus bcks),imsure the cat is fed up,a solonoid in the tranny is going.HMMMMM.Its only worth a good float rod IMO,or scrap metal. This car had a good life and its time for it to go,a very goooood life. BUT THE WIFE SAY NOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!!!!Arghhhhhhh.I say time to put her at rest.

AND NOW!!!!!ARGHHHHH LETS ADD 30grand to the mortgage.WHATTTTT!!!!!FOR A NEW CAR.I HAVENT HAD THE MORTG FOR 5 YRS YET!!!!!!Johnf can you help? ARRRGGGGGHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!A can of wiffey smartner upper will suffice for know!!IM Keeping cool!
